summary:
My mission is to help healthcare professionals in improving the quality and efficiency of their care delivery. Together with problem owners, I love to go through the process of finding out how to work smarter, not harder; and making that work in practice.

Building on a strong analytical background, and being a designer and user of advanced analytical methods, I am intrigued by the social context of how organizations and people therein function. 

I am convinced that with a joint effort, we can take our healthcare system to the next level.

school.name: UMC Utrecht Julius Center, MBI Health
Dutch Network on the Mathematics of Operations Research (LNMB)

education.field_of_study: Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Ancient Greek, Economics, Dutch, English, French

awards.title: Beta Doctoral Dissertation Award
awards.description: Award for the Ph.D. who defended the best Beta Ph.D. thesis in 2012. Awarded for the thesis: Quality-driven Efficiency in Healthcare.
awards.issuer: Beta Research School for Operations Management and Logistics

awards.title: Finalist EURO Doctoral Dissertation Award
awards.description: Award for an outstanding PhD thesis in Operational Research (OR) defended between January 2011 and January 2013 in the countries having an OR society that is member of EURO. Awarded for the PhD thesis: "Quality-driven Efficiency in Healthcare".
awards.issuer: Association of European Operational Research Societies (EURO)

awards.title: INFORMS Interactive Poster Award
awards.description: Award for the best poster presented at the annual conference of INFORMS (the largest professional society in the world for professionals in the field of operations research). Awarded for the poster "Blood platelet optimization for blood banks: theory meets practice".
awards.issuer: Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences (INFORMS)

awards.title: CTIT PhD Carrousel Award
awards.description: Award for the best presentation of PhD research performed within the Centre for Telematics and Information Technology. Awarded for the elevator pitch "The Petri net medical center".
awards.issuer: Centre for Telematics and Information Technology (CTIT)

awards.title: ORTEC Excellence in Advanced Planning Award
awards.description: Award for successful and practical Operations Research by PhD candidates at universities in The Netherlands. Awarded for the project "Optimal Inventory Management of Blood Platelets".

awards.title: Finalist EURO Excellence in Practice Award
awards.description: Award for outstanding accomplishments in the practice of operational research. Awarded for the project "Optimal Inventory Management of Blood Platelets".
awards.issuer: Association of European Operational Research Societies (EURO)

awards.title: H.K. Nieuwenhuis Thesis Award
awards.description: Awarded to students who wrote an  MSc thesis on economics or business of outstanding quality within the Faculty of Economics and Business of the University of Amsterdam. Honourable mention for the thesis "Het optimaal produceren en uitgeven van bloedplaatjes".

profile_positions.description:
Rhythm is an initiative of prof. Richard Boucherie, prof. Erwin Hans, PhD Nikky Kortbeek (CHOIR - Center for Healthcare Operations Improvement and Research, University of Twente) and PhD Bart Veltman (ORTEC).

Its mission is to support healthcare professionals in improving the quality and efficiency of their care delivery. Our services offering includes consulting and software-solutions focused on process optimization and capacity planning.
profile_positions.title: Founder and CEO

profile_positions.description: My mission is to help healthcare professionals in improving the quality and efficiency of their care delivery. Together with clients, I love to go through the process of finding out how to work smarter, not harder; and making that work in practice.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Process Optimization in Healthcare

profile_positions.description: The goal of my research is to help and guide healthcare professionals making their organizations more effective and efficient. By developing mathematical techniques, I intend to support decision makers in realizing the best possible use of available resources.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: The research presented in my dissertation "Quality-driven Efficiency in Healthcare" (cum laude awarded) contributes to a better understanding and functioning of healthcare delivery, by developing mathematical techniques that support the management of healthcare operations.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate Applied Mathematics

profile_positions.description: At the department of Quality Assurance and Process Innovation, which has the goal to support other AMC departments with monitoring and improving the quality of patient care.
profile_positions.title: Research Program Leader Healthcare Logistics / Process Consultant

profile_positions.description: Consultant at the department Quality Assurance and Process Innovation. Projects (selection): redesigning the operations of the internal specialties division, redesigning the surgical inpatient care center, establishing a focused care center for children with neuromuscular diseases.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Patient Logistics

company.name: Cambelltown Hospital & University of Western Sydney

profile_positions.company: Cambelltown Hospital & University of Western Sydney
profile_positions.description: Consultancy/research project "Creating demand-driven staffing levels at the emergency department of Campbelltown Hospital".
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher / Consultant

profile_positions.description: Consultancy/research project based at Sanquin blood bank: optimizing the inventory management of blood platelets. Teacher of the course Advanced Simulation within the MSc. program of Operation Research & Management.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Collaborated on scientific research, teached seminar classes, and graded written work, including final exam papers.
profile_positions.title: Research / Teaching Assistant
